title: undable to connect to gmail with thunderbird after thunderbird update
content:
sending of this message failed The message could not be sent because connecting to Outgoing server SMTP failed. This server may be unavailable or is refusing SMTP connections. Please verify that your Out going server settings are correct and try again

I have deleted the two accounts and added them back, restarted thunderbird but still be the same message. I'm sure this has happened since i updated the thunderbird version
creator: cpcjmann

title: Cannot Rotate a JPEG Attachment in an E-mail
content: When I receive an e-mail that has a JPEG attachment (Windows 10 Professional 64-bit), Thunderbird opens the JPEG image with Microsoft Photo Viewer. When the image opens, I cannot rotate the image. If I save the image and then open that saved image via the same Microsoft application, the rotate icon in the upper left is operative. Is this due to the permissions in the image being opened by Thunderbird from alt/local/temp? Thanks.
creator: bsfinkel

title: Years of messages in Inbox missing & profile shows Inbox file at 0 KB
content: My Inbox showed no messages the last time I started Thunderbird (until Thunderbird started to download new messages). I looked on the C: drive under Profiles, and the Inbox showed 0 KB, when a backup from 10/17/2021, was 1.67 GB (1,753,217 KB). I am not sure how this happened. I think there were Thunderbird updates for a couple of days before I noticed the problem. I had been having trouble with Windows 10 updates, and saved files on an external hard drive on 4/20/25 to back them up, but by then, the Inbox file in my Thunderbird profile showed 0 KB. I am using POP to download emails. Is there any way I can get my emails back? Are they saved somewhere else? Thank you in advance for your help!
creator: amyj.mn

title: How to pause an email account without closing it.
content: I have a work account that is temporarily paused while I am on leave. I am not currently able to log in, so the auto login fails, and keeps bugging me for the correct password, which will not work since the account is temporarily suspended. I don't want to delete the account, there are emails in there I need to access, and the account will be restored when I get back to work. How do I pause the account so it doesn't keep trying repeatedly to log in and asking me for the password?
creator: Don.Daniels3

title: OAuth2 popup is blank
content: Changed hotmail password, now confronted by oauth2 "enter credentials" window. This is blank, no further action occurs, no information can entered into it. Windows 11, TB 137.0.2, cookies accepted, javascript on.
creator: cugeltheclever

title: Passwords Missing
content: I recently "upgraded" my computer from Ubuntu 22.04 LTS to 24.04 LTS. When I did, the installations of both Firefox and Thunderbird was deleted and replaced with snap versions. Luckily, before "upgrading," I made copies of the profile directories and ran a 'backup' in Thunderbird. I was finally able to get Firefox to see the saved passwords, but no matter what I do, Thunderbird refuses. I tried doing a 'restore' using the .zip file that 'backup' created, but that didn't work. So then, I deleted that profile and copied the old profile directory over. All of my settings, contacts and emails are still there, but it REFUSES to acknowledge the saved passwords. I need to know how I can fix this. Thanks.
creator: rebeltaz1

title: Microsofft Windows "Send to" Shortcut with Attachments
content:
Hello,

I have been an Outlook user fro more than 20 years Now gmail will not accept my 'Less secure App" anymore!

I have Thunderbird configured the way I like And I like how it works, Thank you

However I miss a very useful shortcut I used with Outlook in the past

I could highlight files, and use the "Send to" "Mail Recipient" Shortcut... To opened a New Email, and attach the files to an automatically, with a list of the files in the Subject Line Saved a lot of steps (time)!

The trick was accomplished using the attached script

Please tell me if anyone has created something to have the same feature using Thunderbird

Thank you, Richard

title: I am sure that I was able to see 'sent emails' or draft emails but no longer. Why is that?
content:
I am sure when I first began to use Thunderbird, I could see draft emails or sent emails but that feature seems to have disappeared .

Recently I have drafted an email, added an attachment then checked to ensure the correct attachment has been selected then my email has vanished and so needs to be redrafted. Does the step of checking the attachment cause the document to be deleted?

Your advice would be appreciated.

Regards, Kel

title: need to rebuild mail directory file strusture
content:
After changing from POP to IMAP to fix the earlier delivery problem, I have lost the existing file structure, filters, etc. Comcast email is coming in fine but there are only 6 folders while there should be 47 and all the filters s are gone. I have tried rebuilding the current global-messages-db.sqlite file but it stops after 12 hours and was only 10% finished at 2 GB instead of the prior anticipated 16 GB. These are the Profile directories: 04/28/2025 12:53 AM 26,073 MB 3249x1co.default-esr-3 04/27/2025 11:30 PM 358,524 MB 6rvpjum0.default-esr-2 11/21/2024 09:29 PM 249,883 MB 6rvpjum0.default-esr-2_sav 11/21/2024 09:29 PM 6.3 MB dvldbfwi.default-release

How can I resurrect my file system and filters?
creator: d4867

title: Cannot send email - Error
content:
For some time, I cannot send email because of the following error: "Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp.gmail.com timed out. Try again."

How can this error be resolved. I have tried what little I could find here and online. Uninstalled and reinstalled and checked settings. Nothing seems to work so far. Using Win 10 on laptop. Worked fine and then just stopped sending and I was not aware at first until I finally saw the error.
